group_1.textLeft: Hey Ryo, do you always carry that camera with you?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, I can't ever miss a scoop,
so this thing's always by my side.

group_1.textLeft: Eh! Is it one of those things where you even sleep@with it?!

group_1.textRight: Of course I don't go that far.

group_1.textLeft: That's where the straight man comes in!@"It ain't a soccer ball or anythin', ya know!"

group_1.textRight: H-huh...?@That's kind of tough.
Ryo also takes pictures of me.
Yeah!
Ryo takes the absolute cutest pictures of me@when I'm on stage.

group_1.textLeft: Stage!?@Are you a comedian or something?!

group_1.textRight: Nope, I work as a maid at a maid cafe.
[chara:305301:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]*Giggle*@Thank you!
Buut,
I do deliver tons of heart-throbbing smiles to@everyone,
so maybe I'm like a comedian in that sorta way?
...I won't get in trouble for saying that, right?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm, maybe I'll come to Ikumi's place to train as a maid too...

group_1.textRight: I will always welcome you warmly.
Ooh, also!@When talking about me,
feel free to say Ikumin instead, okaay!

group_1.textLeft: That's like some kind of old-fashioned maid,@it's nice!

group_1.textRight: Hmm, you didn't hafta say the old-fashioned part.
Shizuku's delicious house coffee also
makes everyone smile too!

group_1.textLeft: Ah, um, not as much as a maid cafe, but...
I hope, that I can make others happy enough@to smile...

group_1.textRight: Shizuku's house coffee brings relief when you@drink it.
I love iiit.
Mocha bunny!?@Eh! Cute!
Seems to be popular with young kids, that.

group_1.textLeft: As if you're not a young kid yourself...?

group_1.textRight: Ahh sure, I'll be right there.
Shizuku, do you wanna come with?

group_1.textLeft: No, I'm... fine, I guess.@Feels a little embarrassing.

group_1.textRight: Mm, I understand.@I'll be back soon.

group_1.narration: Ikumi was kind enough to pass the conversation to me,@even though I always struggle to say anything.
And Ryo asked me to come with her,@because she knows I have trouble@joining in with them by myself.
Even Ayaka was trying to liven up the place.
And yet, there's still that moment@where I feel like I'm about to lose my footing.
It's just a little difference in enthusiasm@between me and everyone else.
A trivial difference that wouldn't occur if,@for example, I was the kind of person who@wanted to take a picture with everyone.
I'm overwhelmed by the sense@that I'm just floating in midair.
I wonder if I can find peace being with everyone.@I wonder if I can laugh naturally.
It shouldn't be a problem,@but these vague thoughts rise up in my heart,@disappear, and repeat.
